Line 66: Line 66:
Being not in full form, she did not enter the [[2010 World Junior Championships in Athletics|World Junior Championships]] or the [[2010 African Championships in Athletics|African Championships]], both held in July 2010, and opted to target the [[2010 Commonwealth Games|Commonwealth Games]] to be held in October 2010.<ref>CBC, July 21, 2010: [http://www.cbc.ca/sports/amateur/story/2010/07/21/sp-semenya-commonwealth-games.html Semenya has eyes on Commonwealth Games]</ref> She improved her season's best to 1:58.16 at the [[Notturna di Milano]] meeting in early September and returned to South Africa to prepare for the Commonwealth Games.<ref>Sampaolo, Diego (2010-09-10). [http://www.iaaf.org/news/kind=100/newsid=58306.html Howe, Semenya, and Yenew highlight in Milan]. [[IAAF]]. Retrieved on 2010-09-10.</ref> Eventually, she was forced to skip the games due to injury <ref>The Hindu, September 29, 2010: [http://www.thehindu.com/sport/athletics/article802398.ece Injured Semenya pulls out of Commonwealth Games]</ref>
Being not in full form, she did not enter the [[2010 World Junior Championships in Athletics|World Junior Championships]] or the [[2010 African Championships in Athletics|African Championships]], both held in July 2010, and opted to target the [[2010 Commonwealth Games|Commonwealth Games]] to be held in October 2010.<ref>CBC, July 21, 2010: [http://www.cbc.ca/sports/amateur/story/2010/07/21/sp-semenya-commonwealth-games.html Semenya has eyes on Commonwealth Games]</ref> She improved her season's best to 1:58.16 at the [[Notturna di Milano]] meeting in early September and returned to South Africa to prepare for the Commonwealth Games.<ref>Sampaolo, Diego (2010-09-10). [http://www.iaaf.org/news/kind=100/newsid=58306.html Howe, Semenya, and Yenew highlight in Milan]. [[IAAF]]. Retrieved on 2010-09-10.</ref> Eventually, she was forced to skip the games due to injury <ref>The Hindu, September 29, 2010: [http://www.thehindu.com/sport/athletics/article802398.ece Injured Semenya pulls out of Commonwealth Games]</ref>

The debate spurred by Casterâs gender verification tests has implications not only for gender categories in sports, but also demands reflection on the meaning and aims of sports. As our increasing knowledge of genetics challenges our ordinary binary thinking about sexual boundaries, it becomes necessary to deliberate about the catogories for people who fall outside this
  â
dichotomy. Clearly, these decisions need to be informed by scientific evidence, but not only, as at the level of category-setting, regulation should take into account an ethical discussion of the values of sports, such as fairness. <ref> Camporesi S, Maugeri P. [http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20530091 Caster Semenya: sport, categories, and the creative role of ethics] J Med Ethics 2010 36: 378-379</ref>
